key_points: Alec Baldwin fatally shot cinematographer Halyna Hutchins and wounded director Joel Souza on the 'Rust' film set.
Before the shooting, a camera crew walked off the set to protest safety conditions, including concerns over gun safety.
Assistant director Dave Halls handed Baldwin the gun, mistakenly indicating it was safe by declaring it a "cold gun."
Disputes over safety, accommodations, and production conditions had been ongoing since the start of filming.
Previous accidental discharges of firearms on set had raised concerns among crew members.
The shooting occurred during a rehearsal, with one live round killing Hutchins and wounding Souza.
New Mexico workplace safety investigators are reviewing the incident and gun safety protocols.
The film's armorer, Hannah Gutierrez, had recently assumed her role, expressing initial nervousness about her readiness.
Production on 'Rust' was halted following the incident, with the film industry expressing grief and calling for better safety measures.
The incident has reignited discussions around on-set gun safety protocols, with comparisons drawn to past on-set shootings.
